factoid: Lyubím is reddish.
Lyubím rushed forward from behind Mílka.
Lyubím sprang impetuously at the wolf.
Lyubím seized the wolf by its hindquarters.
Lyubím immediately jumped aside in terror.
The wolf crouched.
The wolf gnashed its teeth.
The wolf rose again.
The wolf bounded forward.
All the borzois followed the wolf at a distance of a couple of feet.
The borzois did not get any closer to the wolf.
Nicholas thought "She’ll get away!".
Nicholas thought "No, it’s impossible!".
Nicholas was shouting with a hoarse voice.
Nicholas shouted "Karáy, ulyulyu!...".
Nicholas was looking round for the old borzoi.
The old borzoi was Nicholas's only hope.
Karáy had all the strength age had left him.
Karáy stretched himself to the utmost.
Karáy watched the wolf.
Karáy galloped heavily aside to intercept the wolf.
The wolf’s lope was quick.
The borzoi’s pace was slower.
Karáy miscalculated.
Nicholas could see the wood in front of him.
The wolf would certainly escape if it reached the wood.
Hounds and a huntsman were galloping almost straight at the wolf.
The hounds and huntsman were coming toward Nicholas.
There was still hope.
A long, yellowish young borzoi existed.
Nicholas did not know the young borzoi.
The young borzoi was on another leash.
The young borzoi rushed impetuously at the wolf from in front.
The young borzoi almost knocked the wolf over.
The wolf jumped up more quickly than anyone could have expected.
The wolf gnashing its teeth.
The wolf flew at the yellowish borzoi.
The yellowish borzoi fell with its head on the ground.
The yellowish borzoi was bleeding from a gash in its side.
Nicholas wailed "Karáy? Old fellow!...".
The crossing of the wolf’s path caused a delay.
The old dog had felted hair hanging from its thigh.
The old dog was within five paces of the wolf.
The wolf turned its eyes on Karáy.
The wolf tucked its tail further between its legs.
The wolf increased its speed.
The borzoi was suddenly on the wolf.
The borzoi and the wolf rolled together down into a gully.
Nicholas saw the wolf struggling in the gully with the dogs.
From under the dogs, the wolf's gray hair could be seen.
From under the dogs, the wolf's outstretched hind leg could be seen.
From under the dogs, the wolf's frightened choking head could be seen.
The wolf's ears were laid back.
Karáy was pinning the wolf by the throat.
That instant was the happiest moment of Nicholas's life.
Nicholas had his hand on his saddlebow.
Nicholas was ready to dismount and stab the wolf.
The wolf suddenly thrust its head up from among the mass of dogs.
The wolf's forepaws were on the edge of the gully.
The wolf clicked its teeth.
Karáy no longer had the wolf by the throat.
The wolf leaped out of the gully with a movement of its hind legs.
The wolf disengaged itself from the dogs.
The wolf's tail was tucked in again.
The wolf went forward.
Karáy's hair was bristling.
Karáy was probably bruised or wounded.
Karáy climbed with difficulty out of the gully.
Nicholas cried "Oh my God! Why?" in despair.
Uncle’s huntsman was galloping from the other side across the wolf’s path.
Uncle’s borzois once more stopped the animal’s advance.
The wolf was again hemmed in.
Nicholas was riding round the wolf.
Nicholas's attendant was riding round the wolf.
Uncle was riding round the wolf.
Uncle's huntsman was riding round the wolf.
They were crying "ulyulyu!".
They were shouting.
They were preparing to dismount each moment that the wolf crouched back.
They were starting forward again every time the wolf shook itself.
They were starting forward again when the wolf moved toward the wood where it would be safe.
Daniel had rushed out from the wood at the beginning of the chase.
Daniel was hearing the ulyulyuing.
Daniel saw Karáy seize the wolf.
Daniel checked his horse.
Daniel supposed the affair to be over.
Daniel saw that the horsemen did not dismount.
Daniel saw that the wolf shook itself.
Daniel saw that the wolf ran for safety.
Daniel set his chestnut galloping toward the wood.
Daniel galloped toward the wood not at the wolf.
Daniel galloped toward the wood just as Karáy had run to cut the animal off.
Daniel galloped up to the wolf when the wolf had been stopped a second time by Uncle's borzois.
Daniel galloped up silently.
Daniel held a naked dagger in his left hand.
Daniel thrashing the sides of his chestnut horse with his whip as if it were a flail.
Daniel was using his whip as a flail.
